articles.title: Finnish Preparatory Committee Formed
articles.content:
Finnish Preparatory Committee Formed 
   Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- The Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16 was formed by the Executive Committee of the Finland-Korea Society on Jan. 22.
 Chairman Esko Koskinen and Secretary General Juha Kieksi of the society were elected chairmen of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee decided to host a meeting, a film show and various other functions on the occasion of the Day of the Sun and the February holiday.

articles.title: Joint Statement of DPRK Political Parties, Government and Organizations Supported
articles.content:
Joint Statement of DPRK Political Parties, Government and Organizations Supported 
   Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- The Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Committee of Nepal, the National Press Club of Nepal, the Nepalese Committee for Promotion of Reunification of Korea, the Peace Action Committee of Nepal and the Forum for Self-Reliance Studies of Nepal issued a joint statement on Jan. 24 supporting the joint statement of the political parties, government and organizations of the DPRK.
 The statement extended solidarity to all the Korean people in the north, the south and overseas struggling to add shine to this year as the era of June 15 reunification and make it a year of historic turn in accomplishing the cause of independent and peaceful reunification.    
 It called upon the political parties and organizations of south Korea and the world peace-loving people to intensify the struggle to force the United States to withdraw its troops and military equipment from south Korea and pull down the concrete wall bisecting the Korean Peninsula. It also strongly demanded the U.S. administration discontinue interfering in the internal affairs of Korea and respect the cherished desire of the Korean people to live in a reunified land.

S. Korean Army Announces Plan for "Combat Drill in Severe Cold"
articles.content:
S. Korean Army Announces Plan for "Combat Drill in Severe Cold" 
   Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- The 20th Division of the south Korean army announced that it would stage a "combat drill in severe cold" in the areas of Yangphyong and Ryoju, Kyonggi Province, according to south Korean KBS.
 The war-thirsty elements of the military said they were planning to mobilize huge military hardware including tanks in the war rehearsal scheduled from Jan. 29 to Feb. 2.    
 When all the fellow countrymen are lifting up louder voices than ever before calling for defending peace with concerted efforts, the south Korean bellicose forces are still clinging to reckless war exercises by taking advantage of the aggressive moves of the U.S. imperialists on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Carried in S. Korean Internet
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Carried in S. Korean Internet 
   Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il's famous work "Songun-Based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution" was reportedly carried in the Internet homepage of the National Alliance for Democracy and Reunification of south Korea on Jan. 18.
 After its publication in the Internet homepage, the work is said to have been widely disseminated amid the keen interest of Netizens.

Investigation to Probe into Truth behind Past History Declared
articles.content:
Investigation to Probe into Truth behind Past History Declared 
   Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Committee of Arrangement of Past History for Truth and Reconciliation reportedly gave a press briefing on Jan. 23 and declared that it was entering into an investigation to probe into the truth behind the past history. 
 Speakers there said the committee had received applications for investigation into the sufferings of past victims and the greater part of them turned out to be related to massacre of civilians by the south Korean army, police and right-wing forces.    
 The committee will probe into the truth behind the past history through a thoroughgoing investigation, they stated.
